title: How do u jungle + gank...
body:
So yeah...I start the golem thingy and then I go to red, take wolves and then nearly die taking blue...and then the mid lane's pinging for help and meh...so I recall walk to mid, fail-gank(My hp is dead so i recall again yay! ...no exp._.) and the midlaner walks away with 1/4 hp. 

so...tl dr; How do u not die to jungle camps and gank?

replies.body: It's incredibly dependent on who you are playing. You need to find a balance between sustain, and damage.

> [{quoted}](name=Dawaraven,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=ATO5PPoJ,comment-id=00060000,timestamp=2015-01-28T08:25:01.910+0000)
>
> Is that actually batchy?

yea, my main got banned for calling Pettanko's gf "a 4 at best."

Different champs excel at fighting different camps, so everyone's routes differ severely now. For example, xin zhao is great at taking down gromp but gets rekt by raptors, while amumu does really well against raptors.

If you are playing shaco, one thing I noticed is placing a box right next to the large wolfs nose, then going behind it and attacking, letting the box tank the large wolf, and you tank the small ones allows you to take wolf while taking very small damage.

Also if you get purple smite on shaco (you should!!!), placing a box on the far side of the raptors (furtherest away from large raptor), then smiting and attacking the large raptor is a fast way of taking raptors while taking almost no damage.

Lastly, when you start place your 1st 2 boxes at gromp, then place the next 2 in a line pointing towards blue. Make sure they are out of activation range though. Walk to gromp and kill it with smite once your placed 2 at blue. Once you are done your box is ready to place another at blue. carefully aggro the blue by attacking a small minion once then run away, dragging the buff out into the line of boxes. Attack it while the boxes tank, if its done right you take almost no damage (1 hit maybe).

A couple of things. 
You should get blue smite on shaco, no questions asked. If you want to farm you are playing the wrong champ. You need to be out ganking, and chilling smite is super useful in that situation.
Also, how I play shaco is always start red (clearly you don't need a leash) then go to the other junglers red/blue, depending on where they started. 
From here, you can either wait for them (places boxes in locations so that if they try and run, they get feared) or you can do their buff (assuming that they don't have fast clear, i.e rengar). 
This way one of three things happens. 
You take their buff, not that big of a deal, but the xp loss for the enemy will be annoying. 
You try and kill them, they burn a flash.
You kill them.
There are no other outcomes and I haven't found a better shaco strat yet.

The blue smite isnt actually that useful on shaco. It lets you clear fast pre hydra, and clear instantly once you have hydra. The faster you can clear the more ganks you get. It is also the best fast counterjungling item. Blue smite really doesnt add too much to a shaco gank, because due to invis you will already be on top of them, and once you are on top of them they are slowed. Red smite is also viable on shaco, but I dont really like it.


Going to their buff is pretty obvious shaco strat, the enemy jungler can just start at that camp, or even set a trap for you there.

If you become predictable as shaco you will get outplayed. A lot of junglers (literally all) are stronger than him early he relies on getting the jump on them.

Personally when I play shaco jungle I spam boxes at red, smite krugs but not kill it, kill red, then immediately go kill blue, then gank as on as possible, but this is a very risky and aggressive route.
Do you mean their blue? You can take 1 HP and 1 mana pot if you start red than invade since putting all boxes in 1 buff means you take no damage.
Play udyr that is all or a very tanky early game

maybe have a good look at your runes and masteries, which help SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO much in the jungle, they're the difference between having to back early and being strong enough to do all camps and gank a lane before even going back (which i do on vi). i can sometimes get 3 kills before even having to back. But you need to also play the same champ constantly to know the limitations and strengths etc. Also, look on youtube "season 5 jungle paths" which will help you with which buff/camp you should start etc. I've given good advice, goodluck.
Krugs > Red > Raptors > Base > Blue > Gank
you clear 3 camps and go b.

Well. There are many ways you can go about Jungling and Ganking.
Depending on where you start and what champion you are using to Jungle there are many different routes and paths you can take. From the path you are describing by starting Golems. I would usually run the route of Golem (smite on spawn), red buff. Ideally, depending on the mid lane situation Gank mid then move onto Blue buff or wolves with smite and B. After your first back Jungling should be a lot easier from here on out.

Clear 3 camps then back. You also don't always have to start Krugs and you don't have to clear 1 side only.

Some people prefer Krugs (smite) - Red - Wolves (smite). And use the wolf ward buff to watch if their blue gets stolen.

The point of doing 3 camps and backing is trying to avoid using any pots (or only 1) and having enough money for upgraded smite and wards/pots.

Depends who you play too.

It is a HUGE waste to do krugs - red - blue.
1. your wasting your smite on smiting the blue when you dont need to.
2. Getting blue then backing is pointless. Blue is used so you dont go oom in the jungle, you waste 20 seconds or so of blue buff when you do it then back immediately.

If you're really set on camp - buff - buff change your order. Do Gromp - Blue - Red. Since red gives you health back when you smite it.

Some people like starting red, then ganking at level 2. its unexpected and can usually blow a flash.
depends on who but mostly avoid raptors early(they hurt) unless you are going to b if not go to blue you should be half hp if you play right then gank
